turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah.  How long have you been here?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look, Lester... are you unhappy with me about something?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yeah, I'm unhappy with you about something.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I wanna hear about it, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey, have 'em put me away, or whatever you're gonna do, okay?... I'm too tired to lie, I'm too tired to tell the truth... I'm too tired for anything.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I wanna know your thinking, I wanna know how someone like you thinks. Did you think you could get away with it, did you think you could put something over on me? Does a guy like you get his kicks sneaking around behind people's backs and taking advantage of them? Maybe that's your idea of being anti Establishment!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: That's got nothing to do with it... You're so beyond my comprehension I can't even discuss it with you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Then don't... just have 'em beat me up or whatever you're gonna do.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: No, not yet, not yet. You worry about it for a while, I've been worrying all night, now you can worry.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Was it me, did you have something against me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What, do you think I planned it?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Did they have something against me?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I wanna hear it from you!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: ... how am I gonna tell you what they have against you? I mean Jesus fucking Christ, they're women, aren't they? Have you ever listened to women talk, man? Have you? Well I do, I do 'til it's fucking coming out of my ears. I'm on my feet all day, every fucking day, listening to women talk and you know what they talk about, don't you? Being fucked up by some guy. That's all that's on their minds. I'm sure you've done something they could get pissed off about, what's that got to do with it? All women are pissed off, man, all of 'em. They fucking hate us! Don't you know that?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: ... yes, I follow your thinking on that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We're always trying to fuck them... they know it and they like it and they don't like it... that's just how it is... look, it's got nothing to do with you, man. It just happened. Felicia's got nothing to do but shop and get her hair done and she knows she's getting older... her daughter hates her, what's she going to do, go to PTA meetings?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Do you think Lorna hates her? I don't think she hates her. I mean she may resent her a little...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, are you kidding, man? She hates her.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Why, why do you think that is?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh, fuck, Lester, how should I know?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You don't have a clean glass in the house.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I'll have to wash one out.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Hell of a way to treat a business partner, that's all I can say.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey, you were never going to give me the money.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I was gonna give you the money. Probably I was. Shit, I don't know, I don't know anything anymore.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: ... You can lose it all; you can lose it all no matter who you are... I don't know, what's the point of having it all. Look at me. I don't have a goddam thing... the market's terrible right now, went down ten points last week, goddam Lyndon Johnson!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yeah,, it goes up a little and then it goes down, maybe Nixon will do something. What's the difference, they're all a bunch of jerks. I wouldn't let 'em run my business, I can tell you that much. Not if I had any choice in the matter.  I don't know what to do with you. I don't know, I don't know what's right or wrong anymore.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't either, Lester, I swear to you I don't.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I mean, how did that happen?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Just a whore, I go over there, have a few drinks and get my gun off. I'm through with her, she's nothing but a whore.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, man, no. You can say everybody's a whore. She's okay. I mean Jackie'll fuck around but not that much. Somewhere she really likes you, Lester, and it's not just the bread. She's okay.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, by the way, I think you oughta know -- Lorna thinks she's got the clap.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yeah, the clap. That's what she thinks. But who knows -- I don't know.

turns.speaker: TINA'S VOICE
turns.text: All right, who're you with? Jill?

turns.speaker: JILL'S VOICE
turns.text: I told you I get 'scared up here, so if you're not coming right now...  I'm not kidding.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well, commercials. I read for a soap the other day.

turns.speaker: SID ROTH
turns.text: Well maybe I can get you something.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: That's very sweet of you, Mr. Roth.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Sid. You must be a very important executive.

turns.speaker: SID ROTH
turns.text: Well, whatever I am, I think I can get you whatever you'd like.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- well, more than anything else --  -- I'd like to suck his cock.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The man from Sloan's is coming. I called you about it.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: How did you lose that key? Oh, George, this is uh Miss -- this is Jackie.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh, hi, I mean hello, we've met.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, yes, George is a wonderful hairdresser.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I go to the blue'n gold barber shop in Westwood. The guy in the third chair's dynamite... nobody much.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: George is going to open a shop.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I called to tell you I was sending one over but the line was busy, you're always on the phone.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Who do you think I was talking to?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: My secretary saw you with that boy.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Whatever his name is, that actor.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Steve Slutes, and he's not a boy.  Steve couldn't get arrested as an actor. He couldn't get arrested as a boy.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Then you were talking to him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I ran into him at the 76 station on little Santa Monica, what was I supposed to do, hide in the ladies room? Yes, I was talking to him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I'm always on the phone because you never let me see anybody, I can't even bring my girlfriends over to the house because they might run into you. You're driving me up the wall, Lester. You're even jealous of the dogs. I mean I've gotta have somebody I can talk to.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I'm not jealous of the dogs.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Now listen, Jackie, I'm not jealous of anybody, I just can't afford to get caught... off base.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: So I can't talk to some broken down actor, what do you think, I'm going to tell him I'm screwing Lester Karpf!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: It's very logical, it's the most logical thing in the world. You wouldn't feel this confined if we could go out with people and have dinner, and a little conversation and so forth...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Really? How about starting with tonight?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Look... you do well for people, they don't ask you to stop. Nobody wants you to stop making money, doll, not even Uncle Sam. They all want their share.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're lying about one thing, Lester.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Maybe he ought to go to beauty school. Anyway, see you tonight, doll, okay?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Shut the door, shut the door!

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Just a second, I've gotta clean this mess up or the dogs'll have it all over the house.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You ought to get rid of those dogs.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: They get hair all over the place.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: They're Yorkies and they don't shed.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Aren't you going to have one?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: George, glad you could make it, son. Hi, doll.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Lester, this is my friend Jill and this is Johnny Pope.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Glad to meet you, Jill, Mr. Pope.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Jill Haynes, Jill Haynes, I've told you about Jill a hundred times, Lester, you never remember anything I say.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I don't know. Why don't you ask him?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: C'mon, Jackie, I'm only trying -- George --

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yes, Jackie Shawn, my wi -- Felicia.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, dear that's too bad.  -- get her out of here, get her out of here.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Going for a pony ride at Kiddielands, want to come along?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I have to meet a client... who're you dating?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I think you're crazy. Don't look over, it's Lenny Silverman.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: A real swinger. He's been trying to fuck me for about two hundred years.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Oh, honey, don't be totally naive.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, listen. He's a very good hairdresser.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Jill, I'm just trying to be helpful.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I spent three years with him. I just couldn't take it not knowing who was gonna pay the rent... his unemployment or mine. George was adorable but it drove me crackers. Now at least I'm comfortable. Lester does what he says he'll do. Maybe you're happy living like a gypsy. Are you?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: George is great but I know what you mean.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Face it, you can go around with cute guys and get hung up on their sexy bodies and things like that but sooner or later you've got to find somebody. Face it, time isn't on your side.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Jill, you're a real sweetie pie. You really are.  You're sure you don't mind?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You're really a love -- you sure?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: I thought you said things were great with George.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well they are. But we have problems. You say things are great with Lester. Is he going to marry you?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: We don't think marriage is important.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I don't know. One minute he's up in the air and makes love to me five times a day and tells me everything's going to be great and he's getting his own shop and then suddenly he disappears and he won't even talk to me. It's driving me crazy.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: -- I guess it's all got to do with this shop.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Really, Jill, aren't you exaggerating just a little? Five times a day?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well, you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: After four years? No I don't... and I don't know too many girls who do.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well... it's not so much the number of times he does it, it's... he does it for a long time.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well yes -- you know that about George.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: It's been so long I don't how long?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Quite a while... an hour, an hour and a half -- sometimes forty-five minutes -- that's quite a while, isn't It?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: I think you're going to hit that car in front of us.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: -- See, I just know that if I go to Egypt, well, things happen, I just don't know what'll happen to us, he just never seems to think ahead, does he?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- When you say forty-five minutes or an hour, do you mean continuous time? Just continually, without stopping?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: -- Well -- not going in and out, I don't mean just that. Why are you asking me? You went with George longer than I have.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- I guess I just blocked it out, that's all.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well, there was this one time --

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- I was in the kitchen doing the dishes and George was out in Long Beach doing a show...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- Well it was very hot so I'd left the door open and the water was running so I didn't hear him come down the stairs...

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- He came up behind me and I was wiping a dish and he just... lifted up my skirt, and, you know, right there...

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Didn't you have any panties on?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: -- He reached up and tore them.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Well... I just kept wiping that dish. Maybe it doesn't sound very sexy but it was.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: No, it sounds very sexy -- did you just stay by the sink all that time?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: No, he picked me up and carried me out to the sundeck -- God, it was hot. The wood on the sundeck, everything.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Well, that's where the pyramids are and we want real pyramids in the ad.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Go ahead, Jill, you can say it.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Now I'm embarrassed to tell you.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Why don't you ask for another one?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Are you kidding? His hair's probably the most nutritious thing in here. See, you've reduced me to eating weeds.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: ... my friend doesn't like it here either.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: All right, forget this filth. Continue about your friend.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well he's not exactly a friend.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Of course not... he's sort of a boyfriend.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: I see. You mean he just sort of fucks you.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: My God, did I say that? I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: What does he do? Is he an actor?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: -- oh, sure. A hairdresser. How... how do you a... meet a hairdresser?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Getting your hair done...  Would you like to go to a party?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: This other couple that we're here with, do you know them very well?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Then maybe you can tell me why George would be going into the ladies room.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Well did he go in there with Jackie?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: George is a hairdresser, isn't he?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Well -- as I see it we've got two choices. We can hang around here and wait for the bomb to go off, or we can go to my party.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: -- these bastards have me hemmed in.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Oh, Johnny, Mr. Karpf needed a ride home and I said we'd take him. Do you mind?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: -- so when are you going to Egypt?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: You mean when are you going to Egypt?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Now I didn't mean that, you rat.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Those Arabs won't be when they start chasing you around the sand dunes.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Johnny!  Why didn't you tell me before?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: -- just before I ask you out? I can't do that. Let's get out of here before good old Les catches up with us again.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: We can't really leave that poor man here alone.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: -- still -- at least we should tell him we're going. C'mon.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: I'm telling you he won't know the difference.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: -- his car. They have it blocked.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh that's no problem.  -- take care of this boy's problem, will you, Gene?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: -- listen, I wonder if you kids could give me a ride? I'm kind of stranded here.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: -- oh no, honey, I'll do that...

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: What did you say your name was, sweetheart?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: No... how long did you say?

turns.speaker: PRODUCER
turns.text: Look, is there somewhere else you'd rather go? Maybe we can change our location.

turns.speaker: PRODUCER
turns.text: Do you have something against traveling?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Please don't misunderstand... I'd really like to go.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: I think they're waiting for somebody to start dinner.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: -- we're going to be here all night.

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Terrific. Now all I have to do is find my car keys.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, say, how would you kids like to stop off for a drink?

turns.speaker: POPE
turns.text: Well we'd love to, but we're going to another party.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Well... that's wonderful -- I'll stop by there for a drink.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well you should have eaten your breakfast.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think that was farther west in the Sierras.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There were a party of settlers in the covered wagon times.  They got snowbound one winter in the mountains.  They had to resort to cannabilism in order to stay alive.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You mean they ate each other up?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They had to, in order to survive.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Can I go to my room and get my fire-engine?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come here for a minute, first.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you having a good time?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.  I want you to have a good time.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  I'm just a little tired.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Then why don't you go to sleep?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can't.  I have too much to do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes I do.  I love it.  Don't you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.  I want you to like it here. I wish we could stay here for ever, and ever... ever.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You wouldn't ever hurt Mummy and me, would you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did your mother ever say that to you - that I would hurt you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I love you, Danny.  I love you more than anything else in the whole world, and I'd never do anything to hurt you, never... You know that, don't you, huh?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Now this is where we keep all of out meat.  You got fifteen rib roasts - thirty ten pound bags of hamburgers.  You got twelve- turkeys, two dozen pork roasts and twenty legs of lamb.  Do you like lamb, Doc?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: You don't?  Well what's your favorite food then?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Do you like ice cream, Doc?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Chocolate it shall be.  Come on son.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Why don't you want to talk about it?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Who says you ain't supposed to?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Tony's the little boy who lives in my mouth.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Is Tony the one that tells you things?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: How does he tell you things?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: It's like I go to sleep, and he shows me things but when I wake up, I can't remember everything.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Does your Mum and Dad know about Tony?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Do they know he tell you things?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Now think real hard, Doc.  Think.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Try to think what it was.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: No, I'm scared of nothing here. It's just that you know some places are like people, some shine and some don't.  I guess you could say the Overlook Hotel here has something about it that's like shining.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Well, you know Doc, when something happens it can leave a trace of itself behind... say like is someone burns toast.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Well, maybe things that happened... leave other kinds of traces behind.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Not things that anyone can notice, but things that people who shine can see.  Just like they can see things that haven't happened yet. Well, sometimes they can see things that happened a long time ago... I think a lot of things happened right here in this particular hotel - over the years, and not all of them was good.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mr. Halloran, what is in Room 237?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Nothing.  There ain't nothing in Room 237, but you ain't got no business going in there anyway, so stay out!  You understand, stay out!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Do you really want to go and live in that hotel for the winter?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Sure, Danny, it will be lots of fun.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess so.  Anyway, there's hardly anybody to play with around here.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  It always takes a little time to make new friends.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: What about Tony?  He's looking forward to the hotel, I bet.
